questions.question: What is the primary purpose of values clarification in sexual health education?
choices: To impose societal norms on individuals
To help individuals identify principles that guide their choices
To determine which values are universally correct
To eliminate cultural differences in values
questions.answer: To help individuals identify principles that guide their choices

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a step in the 5-step decision-making model presented in the module?
choices: Identify the decision to be made
questions.answer: Consult with a religious leader

questions.question: What does the acronym SMART stand for in goal-setting?
questions.answer: Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a physical boundary in a relationship?
questions.answer: Personal space preferences

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of setting boundaries in relationships?
choices: To promote mutual respect and ensure personal safety
To test the strength of the relationship
questions.answer: To promote mutual respect and ensure personal safety

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common value related to sexual health mentioned in the module?
questions.answer: Competitiveness

questions.question: What is consent in the context of sexual relationships?
choices: A legal document signed before sexual activity
Voluntary agreement to engage in sexual activity, given without coercion
A one-time permission that applies to all future encounters
Implicit agreement based on past behavior
questions.answer: Voluntary agreement to engage in sexual activity, given without coercion

questions.question: Which of the following is a key component of effective boundary communication?
choices: Using vague language to avoid conflict
Letting others set boundaries for you
questions.answer: Using clear, direct language

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Values Continuum' warm-up activity?
choices: To rank students based on their values
To identify students with incorrect values
To help students visualize different perspectives on values
To teach students the correct values to hold
questions.answer: To help students visualize different perspectives on values

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a SMART goal for sexual health?
choices: I will learn about contraception someday
I will schedule a sexual health check-up at the local clinic within the next month
questions.answer: I will schedule a sexual health check-up at the local clinic within the next month

questions.question: What is the purpose of using 'I' statements when communicating boundaries?
choices: To place blame on the other person
To express personal needs and feelings without accusation
To demonstrate superiority in the relationship
questions.answer: To express personal needs and feelings without accusation

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of boundary mentioned in the module?
questions.answer: Financial

questions.question: What is the recommended approach when faced with pressure to engage in sexting?
choices: Give in to avoid seeming uncool
Ignore the request and hope it goes away
Respond clearly stating your discomfort and boundaries
Share the request with others to embarrass the person
questions.answer: Respond clearly stating your discomfort and boundaries

questions.question: Which of the following is a key consideration when evaluating consequences in decision-making?
choices: Both short-term and long-term effects on self and others
Only effects that align with personal values
questions.answer: Both short-term and long-term effects on self and others

questions.question: What is the purpose of the personal goal-setting exercise in the module?
choices: To compare students' goals with each other
To set standardized goals for all students
To help students plan for their sexual and reproductive health future
questions.answer: To help students plan for their sexual and reproductive health future

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a suggested item to cover in the module?
choices: Local cultural beliefs related to sexuality
questions.answer: Religious doctrines on sexuality

questions.question: What is the purpose of the decision-making scenarios activity?
choices: To practice applying the decision-making model to real-life situations
To determine which students make the best decisions
To teach students the correct decisions for each scenario
questions.answer: To practice applying the decision-making model to real-life situations

questions.question: Which of the following is a recommended practical experience in the module?
choices: Visiting a local health clinic or family planning center
questions.answer: Visiting a local health clinic or family planning center

questions.question: What is the purpose of the reflective journal entry assignment?
choices: To share personal information with the class
To explore personal values related to relationships and sexuality
To critique others' values and beliefs
questions.answer: To explore personal values related to relationships and sexuality

questions.question: Which organization's materials are suggested as additional resources in the module?
choices: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
questions.answer: World Health Organization

questions.question: What is the purpose of the research assignment on local health services?
choices: To compare the quality of different health services
To familiarize students with available resources for sexual health
To encourage students to become healthcare providers
questions.answer: To familiarize students with available resources for sexual health

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a type of boundary in relationships?
questions.answer: Financial

questions.question: What is the recommended approach when diagnosed with a curable STI?
choices: Keep it a secret to avoid embarrassment
Inform current partners and consider informing previous partners
Post about it on social media to raise awareness
questions.answer: Inform current partners and consider informing previous partners

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a component of the SMART goal framework?
questions.answer: Attractive

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the boundary-setting role play activity?
choices: To identify students with poor communication skills
To practice communicating personal boundaries effectively
To create dramatic scenarios for discussion
questions.answer: To practice communicating personal boundaries effectively

questions.question: Which of the following is a key consideration when reflecting on the outcome of a decision?
choices: How to blame others for negative outcomes
How to avoid making decisions in the future
How to learn from the experience for future decision-making
How to hide the decision from others
questions.answer: How to learn from the experience for future decision-making

questions.question: What is the recommended approach when a partner wants to share passwords for all social media accounts?
choices: Share fake passwords to appease them
Communicate your value of privacy and set a boundary
questions.answer: Communicate your value of privacy and set a boundary

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a practical experience or community engagement opportunity?
questions.answer: Political campaign participation

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of discussing cultural considerations in the values clarification section?
choices: To promote one culture over others
To encourage students to reject their cultural background
To reflect on how personal values align or differ from cultural norms
questions.answer: To reflect on how personal values align or differ from cultural norms

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a type of resource required for the module?
questions.answer: Virtual reality simulations
